resources.string: Iconic, 605-ft.-tall spire at the Seattle Center, with an observation deck and a rotating restaurant.
Pike Place Market is a public market overlooking the Elliott Bay waterfront in Seattle, Washington, United States.
Chihuly Garden and Glass is an exhibit in the Seattle Center showcasing the studio glass of Dale Chihuly.
The Museum of Pop Culture, or MoPOP is a nonprofit museum dedicated to contemporary popular culture.
Seattle Center is an arts, educational, tourism and entertainment center in Seattle, Washington, United States.
Kerry Park is a 1.26-acre park on the south slope of Queen Anne Hill, located at the corner of Second Avenue West and West Highland Drive.
Gas Works Park, in Seattle, Washington, is a 19.1-acre public park on the site of the former Seattle Gas Light Company gasification plant.
Woodland Park Zoo is a zoological garden located in the Phinney Ridge neighborhood of Seattle, Washington.
"The Olympic Sculpture Park, created and operated by the Seattle Art Museum, is a park, free and open to the public that opened on January 20, 2007."
Brick-walled cafe serving Reubens, crêpes, salads and such accompanied by coffee drinks or even wine.
Korean dishes prepared with French technique in a modern industrial-design space with a hopping bar.
Sleek spot for inventive sushi rolls, izakaya-style snacks and sake served late-night.
Sparkling chandeliers and gauzy drapes set the sophisticated mood at this upscale Italian restaurant.
Chinese New Year\'s Celebration and Dragon Dance

Early in February, the Wu Hsing Tao School celebrates Chinese New Year with an open house for prospective students interested in healing through Five Element Acupuncture, featuring caligraphy demonstrations, a Dragon Dance by Master Mak, and more. Call (206) 324-7188 for more information.

In mid to late May, Pike Place Market hosts local and international cheese makers and a selection of over 250 cheeses, cooking demonstrations, a wine garden, a cheese maze for the kids, and 'cheese fest best' dishes are served at selected local restaurants. Call (202) 285-6100 for more information.
On Father’s Day weekend at St. Edwards State Park, festival-goers enjoy plenty of suds and food, band music, a keg toss and more, including a root beer garden for kids.

Celebration of salmon returning to area lakes, streams and the downtown hatchery draws crowds of more than 150,000 during the first full weekend in October. Featured are more than 300 artists, Foods of the World, a Grande Parade, 5k/10k runs, four stages of live entertainment, and more. Call (425) 392-0661 for more information.
